headline: While E.P.A. Strips Protections, Raw Sewage Can Keep Flowing
abstract: The agency is allowing cities to delay or otherwise change federally imposed fixes to their sewer systems.
lead_paragraph: The Environmental Protection Agency has made it easier for cities to keep dumping raw sewage into rivers by letting them delay or otherwise change federally imposed fixes to their sewer systems, according to interviews with local officials, water utilities and their lobbyists.
